subject: Re: [junit] Asserting object equality in junit 3.8.1
msgSnippet: ... Also, don t compare File objects for equality, because that s ambiguous. Do you want to compare file basenames? or file paths? or file contents? The first
messageBody:
On 2009-03-04, at 09:15 , Maria Pavlova wrote:

> ok, thank s!

Also, don't compare File objects for equality, because that's
ambiguous. Do you want to compare file basenames? or file paths? or
file contents? The first two are strings, so you can use
assertEquals() on them directly. The last is either a string or a byte
array, and you can find ArrayAssert in the project JUnit-addons to
compare arrays to each other.

Take care.
----
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.ca

JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
2005 Gordon Pask Award for contributions to Agile Software Practice
